structure.unit: Crimes, Punishments And Proceedingsin Criminal Cases
Felonies, Accessories And Attempts To Commit Crimes

law.catch_line: Felonâ€™S Conviction Or Amenability To Justice; Venue
law.text: An accessory to a felony after the fact may be indicted, convicted and punished, whether the principal felon has or has not been previously convicted, or is or is not amenable to justice, either in the county where he became an accessory or in the county where the principal felony was committed.
